claim: In the duel format, the ten cards with the highest mana cost are Astral Cornucopia, Entreat the Angels, Quarantine Field, Mass Manipulation, Hour of Eternity, Recall, Part Water, Fall of the Titans, Bonfire of the Damned, and Release the Gremlins.
extra_info: duels refer to format = 'duel'; the highest uncoverted mana cost refers to MAX(manaCost)
reasoning: The claim lists 10 specific cards as having the highest mana cost in duel format. While the 7 cards with the highest unique manaCost values are correctly identified, the claim then selects only 3 cards (Release the Gremlins, Bonfire of the Damned, Fall of the Titans) from a group of 6 cards all tied at manaCost = '{X}{X}{R}', omitting Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, and Conflagrate which have the same mana cost. The claim cannot accurately state these are 'the ten cards with the highest mana cost' when there are actually 13 cards sharing the top mana cost values.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "cards"
(
    id                      INTEGER           not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    artist                  TEXT,
    asciiName               TEXT,
    availability            TEXT,
    borderColor             TEXT,
    cardKingdomFoilId       TEXT,
    cardKingdomId           TEXT,
    colorIdentity           TEXT,
    colorIndicator          TEXT,
    colors                  TEXT,
    convertedManaCost       REAL,
    duelDeck                TEXT,
    edhrecRank              INTEGER,
    faceConvertedManaCost   REAL,
    faceName                TEXT,
    flavorName              TEXT,
    flavorText              TEXT,
    frameEffects            TEXT,
    frameVersion            TEXT,
    hand                    TEXT,
    hasAlternativeDeckLimit INTEGER default 0 not null,
    hasContentWarning       INTEGER default 0 not null,
    hasFoil                 INTEGER default 0 not null,
    hasNonFoil              INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isAlternative           INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isFullArt               INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOnlineOnly            INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOversized             INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isPromo                 INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isReprint               INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isReserved              INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isStarter               INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isStorySpotlight        INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isTextless              INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isTimeshifted           INTEGER default 0 not null,
    keywords                TEXT,
    layout                  TEXT,
    leadershipSkills        TEXT,
    life                    TEXT,
    loyalty                 TEXT,
    manaCost                TEXT,
    mcmId                   TEXT,
    mcmMetaId               TEXT,
    mtgArenaId              TEXT,
    mtgjsonV4Id             TEXT,
    mtgoFoilId              TEXT,
    mtgoId                  TEXT,
    multiverseId            TEXT,
    name                    TEXT,
    number                  TEXT,
    originalReleaseDate     TEXT,
    originalText            TEXT,
    originalType            TEXT,
    otherFaceIds            TEXT,
    power                   TEXT,
    printings               TEXT,
    promoTypes              TEXT,
    purchaseUrls            TEXT,
    rarity                  TEXT,
    scryfallId              TEXT,
    scryfallIllustrationId  TEXT,
    scryfallOracleId        TEXT,
    setCode                 TEXT,
    side                    TEXT,
    subtypes                TEXT,
    supertypes              TEXT,
    tcgplayerProductId      TEXT,
    text                    TEXT,
    toughness               TEXT,
    type                    TEXT,
    types                   TEXT,
    uuid                    TEXT              not null
        unique,
    variations              TEXT,
    watermark               TEXT
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "legalities"
(
    id     INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    format TEXT,
    status TEXT,
    uuid   TEXT
        references cards (uuid)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "legalities"
(
    id     INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    format TEXT,
    status TEXT,
    uuid   TEXT
        references cards (uuid)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Now I understand the schema. The claim is about cards in the "duel" format with the highest `manaCost`. Let me query for the top 10 cards by manaCost in the duel format.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT c.name, c.manaCost FROM cards c JOIN legalities l ON c.uuid = l.uuid WHERE l.format = 'duel' ORDER BY c.manaCost DESC LIMIT 20;"
input.description: Get top cards by manaCost in duel format

content.text:
The query returns cards sorted by `manaCost` as a string. I can see the top entries. The claim lists 10 specific cards as having the highest mana cost. But I notice that the string sorting puts `{X}{X}{X}` first, then `{X}{X}{W}{W}{W}`, etc. The hint says "highest unconverted mana cost refers to MAX(manaCost)" which means we're sorting the manaCost string.

Looking at the results, the top 10 by string-sorted manaCost would be:
1. Astral Cornucopia - `{X}{X}{X}`
2. Entreat the Angels - `{X}{X}{W}{W}{W}`
3. Quarantine Field - `{X}{X}{W}{W}`
4. Mass Manipulation - `{X}{X}{U}{U}{U}{U}`
5. Hour of Eternity - `{X}{X}{U}{U}{U}`
6. Recall - `{X}{X}{U}`
7. Part Water - `{X}{X}{U}`
8. Release the Gremlins - `{X}{X}{R}`
9. Bonfire of the Damned - `{X}{X}{R}`
10. Meteor Shower - `{X}{X}{R}`

But the claim says "Fall of the Titans" is in the top 10 instead of "Meteor Shower". Let me check - there are ties at `{X}{X}{R}` (Release the Gremlins, Bonfire of the Damned, Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, Fall of the Titans, Conflagrate). The claim picks specific cards from among this tied group but omits others like Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, and Conflagrate.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT c.name, c.manaCost FROM cards c JOIN legalities l ON c.uuid = l.uuid WHERE l.format = 'duel' AND c.manaCost = '{X}{X}{R}' ORDER BY c.name;"
input.description: Count cards with manaCost {X}{X}{R} in duel format

content.text:
There are 6 cards with manaCost `{X}{X}{R}`. The claim includes only 3 of them (Release the Gremlins, Bonfire of the Damned, Fall of the Titans) and excludes the other 3 (Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, Conflagrate). 

The positions 1-7 are clear (7 distinct cards with unique or higher mana costs). Then positions 8-10 need to come from the 6 tied cards with `{X}{X}{R}`. The claim cherry-picks 3 out of 6 tied cards, which means the claim that these are "the ten cards with the highest mana cost" is inaccurate — there are actually more than 10 cards tied for the top 10 positions.

Since the claim specifically says these are "the ten cards" with the highest mana cost, but in reality there are 12 cards tied at the top level (7 unique + 6 tied at `{X}{X}{R}` = 13 cards sharing the top mana cost values, with only 10 slots), the claim selectively excludes some tied cards. This makes the claim **CONTRADICTED** because it asserts a definitive top-10 list but omits cards that have equally high mana costs (Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, Conflagrate).

While the 7 cards with the highest unique manaCost values are correctly identified, the claim then selects only 3 cards (Release the Gremlins, Bonfire of the Damned, Fall of the Titans) from a group of 6 cards all tied at manaCost = '{X}{X}{R}', omitting Meteor Shower, Builder's Bane, and Conflagrate which have the same mana cost. The claim cannot accurately state these are 'the ten cards with the highest mana cost' when there are actually 13 cards sharing the top mana cost values."}
